com.ppm.integration.agilesdk.pm

Class ExternalTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ppm.integration.agilesdk.pm.ExternalTask

  • public abstract class ExternalTask
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores task scheduling & structure information. For actuals data, see getActuals() and ExternalTaskActuals.
    Since:
    PPM9.41

      java.lang.Double getScheduledDurationOverrideValue()
      Upon work plan synchronization, PPM will automatically compute the task duration based on task start and finish dates, using the project regional calendar to account for non-working days.
      If you do NOT want PPM to do that, make this field return a non-null duration value, and it will be used in the work plan.
      Default value is null, meaning that PPM will automatically compute the duration.

      Task Scheduled Finish Date.

      Indicates whether this task is a major milestone or not (false by default).
      If both isMajorMilestone() and isMilestone() return true, the task is considered a major milestone.
      boolean isMilestone()
      Indicates whether this task is a minor milestone or not (false by default).
      If both isMajorMilestone() and isMilestone() return true, the task is considered a major milestone.

      • getStatus

        public ExternalTask.TaskStatus getStatus()
        Task status from external application This property will be mapped to PPM Task status. Notice that, PPM Task status may not follow its returned value, due to internal business logic and dependencies.
        Default task status will be READY.
        Returns:
        Task Status
        See Also:
        ExternalTask.TaskStatus

      • getScheduledFinish

        By default, will return the current date at 23:59 (end of the day)
        Returns:

      • getScheduledDurationOverrideValue

        public java.lang.Double getScheduledDurationOverrideValue()
        Upon work plan synchronization, PPM will automatically compute the task duration based on task start and finish dates, using the project regional calendar to account for non-working days.
        If you do NOT want PPM to do that, make this field return a non-null duration value, and it will be used in the work plan.
        Default value is null, meaning that PPM will automatically compute the duration.
        Returns:
        the scheduled duration of this task, if we do not want PPM to automatically compute it.

      • getPercentCompleteOverrideValue

        public java.lang.Double getPercentCompleteOverrideValue()
        Allows to override PPM computed percent complete value for summary tasks only (not for leaf tasks).
        Upon work plan synchronization, PPM will automatically compute percent complete of summary tasks by rolling up percent complete of children tasks, weighted by children tasks duration. This % complete value will differ from the value that could be computed in the external systems, for example if they use effort-based % complete instead of task duration (this is actually the case of most products). If you do NOT want PPM to automatically compute % complete for the task, make this field return a non-null % complete value, and it will be used in the work plan.
        Default value is null, meaning that PPM will automatically compute the % complete.
        This won't work for leaf tasks - their % complete will always be computed from the actuals.
        Returns:
        the % complete value of this task, if we do not want PPM to automatically compute it during work plan rollup.

      • getOwnerRole

        public java.lang.String getOwnerRole()
        Role of the Task Owner, or null/empty string if not defined (default value). This will set the task Role in PPM work plan if defined. The value must match the role name defined in PPM Roles list.
        Returns:
        Role name of task owner, or null/empty if no role is defined.

      • getActuals

        public java.util.List<ExternalTaskActuals> getActuals()
        List of Task Actuals, aka Work Units. You can have only one resource assigned per ExternalTaskActuals object, so you'll need more than one if multiple resources are working on the task. Multiple ExternalTaskActuals with the same resource ID (or no Resource ID/ invalid Resource ID) will be aggregated together automatically.
        Returns:
        List of Task Actuals.

      • getOwnerId

        public long getOwnerId()
        PPM User ID of task owner, or -1 if this task has no owner (default value).
        Returns:
        PPM userId of the task owner.
        See Also:
        UserProvider

      • isMilestone

        public boolean isMilestone()
        Indicates whether this task is a minor milestone or not (false by default).
        If both isMajorMilestone() and isMilestone() return true, the task is considered a major milestone.
        Returns:
        whether the task is a minor milestone.

      • isMajorMilestone

        public boolean isMajorMilestone()
        Indicates whether this task is a major milestone or not (false by default).
        If both isMajorMilestone() and isMilestone() return true, the task is considered a major milestone.
        Returns:
        whether the task is a major milestone.
        Since:
        PPM 9.42

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<ExternalTask> getChildren()
        Children tasks of current task
        Returns:
        list of children tasks

      • getUserDataFields

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,ExternalTask.UserData> getUserDataFields()
        Returns the User Data values for this task (if defined in PPM), with the key being the User Data Column Index. (1-based, same as defined in the workbench)

        It is the responsibility of the connector to provide the correct code & visible value for the user data field, especially when these are auto-complete validations. The Agile SDK will insert values as-is in the user data fields and will not validate them against the PPM validation.
        If this method returns one or more user data fields, the default user data values for the task will not work, the connector is responsible to set all user data fields. However, if you return null (or an empty list), PPM logic will take effect and the default User Data values will be set.
        Returns:
        a map containing task user data fields, where key is the user data column index.
        Since:
        9.42

      • adjustFinishDateTime

        protected java.util.Date adjustFinishDateTime(java.util.Date date)
        Dates returned from external systems don't have time set and are set to midnight (i.e. start of the day). However, a date set as a finish date usually means "after the day as finished", and we need to set the hour to the end of the day (23:00) so that PPM computes duration correctly.
        This will return a modified date, and will keep date passed in parameter unmodified.
        Parameters:
        date - the date to adjust and set to 23:00.
        Returns:
        the date with the time set to the end of the day.

      • adjustStartDateTime

        protected java.util.Date adjustStartDateTime(java.util.Date date)
        Dates returned from external systems don't always have time set or use some default time. This method will ensure that time is set at 1:00 am (start of the date) so that PPM computes duration correctly.
        This will return a modified date, and will keep date passed in parameter unmodified.
        Parameters:
        date - the date to adjust and set to 1:00 am.
        Returns:
        the date with the time set to the start of the day.
